abstract: Hertz Global Holdings agreed on Sunday to raise its takeover offer for the Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group to about $1.4 billion in stock and cash, trumping a rival offer from the Avis Budget Group.
snippet: Hertz Global Holdings agreed on Sunday to raise its takeover offer for the Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group to about $1.4 billion in stock and cash, trumping a rival offer from the Avis Budget Group.
lead_paragraph: 6:55 p.m. | Updated Hertz Global Holdings agreed on Sunday to raise its takeover offer for the Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group to about $1.43 billion in stock and cash, trumping a rival offer from the Avis Budget Group.

headline.main: Hertz and Dollar Thrifty Agree to New $1.43 Billion Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
